title: Digital $k$-continuity, digital $k$-isomorphism, local $k$-isomorphism, radius $2$-local $k$-isomorphism, and digital $k$-homotopy
abstract:
The present paper refers to the notions of digital continuity, digital
$k$-isomorphism, local $k$-isomorphism, radius $2$-local $k$-isomorphism, and
digital $k$-homotopy motivated by the Khalimsky's version.
  We discuss something incorrectly mentioned in Boxer's papers and suggest some
accurate information.
